context: If I already have Tera on my laptop, can I use the code to get the goodies, and use the disk to install on another PC?
response: You can install Tera on as many PCs as you like. However, the code of goodies is tied to your online account with which you registered on Tera (eg. Mark@someemail.com). Hope this helps.

context: With Titanfall for PC ... are you playing against XBOX One, etc, players? Also, can you pull your game data from XBOX Live account (I take it not)?
response: To answer my own question (after the fact) ... With the PC version, you are playing against other PC players. You cannot pull from or use your XBox Live account information nor pull your game data from there. Two completely different universes, though the game plays the same exact way (sans controller v. keyboard/mouse thing).

context: If your joystick is worn out (i.e. stick is wobbly or loose) will this replacement piece fix that?
response: It will not. A wobbly stick is caused by the joystick box, the thing you plug the rubber piece into. To fix a wobbly stick you either have to get a new controller or solder a different box on.

context: Is this compatible with a Macbook Pro?
response: Yes but you have to visit saitek.com downloads for the mac drivers.

context: Why doesnt II download but III does and they are on the same disk?
response: I am  running Windows 7 64 bit and I had no problems installing II and III from the CD.  Maybe you received a bad CD.  Contact Amazon.  It only took me about 1 minute to install.

context: Does this video game come with the manual booklet? and also is this the greatest hits version or the standard gold edition version packaging?
response: The original standard black label edition comes with the manual.  The Greatest Hits version does not include the manual.  The Greatest Hits is extremely light whereas the black label edition is heavier, plus you can see thru the clear case at the top & bottom & sides that there's a manual inside.

context: So this is like Warcraft you have to play on line.. I hate that
response: No and yes. Has an offline single player campaign (well you log on online but that's to save progress), well worth it for story alone.Also has online multiplayer where you can play vs other people. Oh, online is FREE, no subscription req'd.

context: Ok, so this may sound lame, but what does MMO mean, and is this wireless?
response: mmo = massively multiplayer online, basically games like world of warcraft, rift, star wars old republic are mmo's. This particular model of the razer naga is not wireless. However it gives you plenty of cord length to move around freely. This one is wireless -----> Razer Naga Epic Rechargable Wireless MMO PC Gaming Mouse

context: Is this game exclusively for XBox One - or can it be played on an XBox?

context: Is this a knockoff or is this an original 360 controller?
response: I believe this is a knock off. It feels and looks like a real controller though. It has the same case as the real controller. Just the case has chinese letters. I've had the controller for 2 weeks now and I have had no problems. So for the price, I would get it.

response: Yes. It works on Windows 8 and 8.1 operating systems - 32 and 64-bit (laptop or desktop).

context: What are the bare minimum PC system requirements?
response: Intel Core 2 quad 2.66Ghz, or AMD Athlon II x4,  6GB RAM, Nvidia Geforce GTX 460 768MB, or AMD Radeon 5770 1024MB. You can get away with 4GB RAM though , with some minor performance issues.

context: Hello!! Can I use this PS4 in Italy?
response: In theory yes. As all the systems are region free. But you may need to pick up a different power cable. I'm not sure what your outlet situation is like there. But the systems are region free and language selectable so you should be fine.
